org.jooby

Interface Session


  • public interface Session
    Sessions are created on demand from Request.session(). Sessions have a lot of uses cases but most commons are: auth, store information about current user, etc.

    Session configuration

    Session timeout

    Session timeout is defined by the application.session.timeout property, by default a session will be invalidated after 1800 seconds (30 minutes) of inactivity. Alternative, you can set session timeout from Session.Definition.timeout(int).

    Session persistence

    Session data can be persisted, in order to do that you must provide an implementation of Session.Store. Sessions are kept in memory, by default.

    Sessions are persisted every time a request exit if they are dirty. A session get dirty if an attribute is added or removed from it.

    The application.session.saveInterval property indicates how frequently a session will be persisted. Again, it will be persisted at the time a request exit.

    In short, a session is persisted when: 1) are dirty; or 2) save interval is expired it.

    Finally, the application.session.preseverOnStop indicates whenever existing session need to be store at exit time (persisted) or not (invalidated). By default session are preserved on stop.

    Cookie configuration

    A cookie will be created when a session is created. Cookie is signed using application.secret. For dev mode the default secret is set to the location of the Jooby class. For others an application.secret MUST be set, otherwise the application will fail at startup.

    The application.session.cookie.name indicates the name of the cookie that hold the session ID, by defaults: jooby.sid. Cookie's name can be explicitly set with Cookie.Definition.name(String) on Session.Definition.cookie().

    The application.session.cookie.maxAge sets the maximum age in seconds. A positive value indicates that the cookie will expire after that many seconds have passed. Note that the value is the maximum age when the cookie will expire, not the cookie's current age. A negative value means that the cookie is not stored persistently and will be deleted when the Web browser exits. A zero value causes the cookie to be deleted. Default maxAge is: -1. Cookie's name can be explicitly set with Cookie.Definition.name(String) on Session.Definition.cookie().

    A session cookie is marked as secure and httpOnly.

    Please note that session data is NOT persisted in the cookie, just the session ID. If need to persist a session, see Session.Store

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    edgar

      Read, save and delete sessions from a persistent storage.

    • Field Detail

    • Method Detail

      • id

        @Nonnull
String id()
        Returns:
        Session ID.

      • createdAt

        long createdAt()
        Returns:
        The time when this session was created, measured in milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970 GMT.

      • accessedAt

        long accessedAt()
        The last time the client sent a request associated with this session, as the number of milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970 GMT, and marked by the time the container received the request.

        Actions that your application takes, such as getting or setting a value associated with the session, do not affect the access time.

        Returns:
        Last time the client sent a request.

      • expiryAt

        long expiryAt()
        Returns:
        The time when this session is going to expire, measured in milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970 GMT.

      • get

        @Nonnull
<T> Optional<T> get(@Nonnull
                             String name)
        Get a object from this session. If the object isn't found this method returns an empty optional.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Target type.
        Parameters:
        name - A local var's name.
        Returns:
        A value or empty optional.

      • attributes

        @Nonnull
Map<String,Object> attributes()
        Returns:
        An immutable copy of local attributes.

      • isSet

        default boolean isSet(@Nonnull
                      String name)
        Test if the var name exists inside the session local attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - A local var's name.
        Returns:
        True, for existing locals.

      • set

        @Nonnull
Session set(@Nonnull
                     String name,
                     @Nonnull
                     Object value)
        Set a session local using a the given name. If a local already exists, it will be replaced with the new value. Keep in mind that ONLY none null values are allowed.
        Parameters:
        name - A local var's name.
        value - A local values.
        Returns:
        This session.

      • unset

        <T> Optional<T> unset(String name)
        Remove a local value (if any) from session locals.
        Type Parameters:
        T - A local type.
        Parameters:
        name - A local var's name.
        Returns:
        Existing value or empty optional.

      • unset

        Session unset()
        Unset/remove all the session data.
        Returns:
        This session.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Invalidates this session then unset any objects bound to it.
